title: Headings
description: To create a heading, add number signs # in front of a word or phrase. The number of number signs you use should correspond to the heading level. For example, to create a heading level three <h3>, use three number signs e.g., ### My Header

title: Emphasis
description: You can add emphasis by making text bold or italic. To italicize text, add one asterisk or underscore before and after a word or phrase. To italicize the middle of a word for emphasis, add one asterisk without spaces around the letters.
markdown:
**Bold**

~~Strikethrough~~

*Italic*

==Mark==

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, ***consectetur*** adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor ~~incididunt ut labore et dolore~~ magna aliqua.

title: Lists
description: You can organize items into ordered and unordered lists. To create an ordered list, add line items with numbers followed by periods. The numbers donâ€™t have to be in numerical order, but the list should start with the number one. To create an unordered list, add dashes -, asterisks *, or plus signs + in front of line items. Indent one or more items to create a nested list.
markdown:
1. Ordered list
    1. Ordered list
    2. Ordered list
        1. Ordered list
2. Ordered list

---

- Unordered list
    - Unordered list
    - Unordered list
        - Unordered list
- Unordered list

title: Links
description: To create a link, enclose the link text in brackets e.g., [Takabase] and then follow it immediately with the URL in parentheses e.g., (https://takabase.com). You can optionally add a title for a link. This will appear as a tooltip when the user hovers over the link. To add a title, enclose it in quotation marks after the URL.
markdown: My favorite app is [Takabase](https://takabase.com "The best app")

title: Blockquotes
description: To create a blockquote, add a > in front of a paragraph. Blockquotes can be nested. Add a >> in front of the paragraph you want to nest.
markdown:
> Dorothy followed her through many of the beautiful rooms in her castle

---

> Dorothy followed her through many of the beautiful rooms in her castle
>> The Witch bade her clean the pots and kettles and sweep the floor and keep the fire fed with wood

title: Code
description: To denote a word or phrase as code, enclose it in backticks `. The Markdown syntax allows you to create fenced code blocks. You should use three backticks ``` on the lines before and after the code block. Read here for more information.

title: Diagrams
description: To create and modify diagrams dynamically you can use syntax of Mermaid.js JavaScript based diagramming and charting tool. For more detailed information about it, please read here
markdown:
``` mermaid
graph LR
  A[Square Rect] -- Link text --> B((Circle))
  A --> C(Round Rect)
  B --> D{Rhombus}
  C --> D
```

title: Images
description: To add an image, add an exclamation mark !, followed by alt text in brackets, and the path or URL to the image asset in parentheses. You can optionally add a title in quotation marks after the path or URL.

title: Advanced
description: Add classes, identifiers and attributes to your markdown with {.class .class2 attr=value} curly brackets. Feel free to show your imagination and use the large set of CSS classes available here
